header_1: H5N1 in Wild birds in Mongolia
content_1: An outbreak of H5N1 bird flu in migratory whooper swans has been reported in the Ugii-nuur soum (district) of Arkhangai. Nine of the swans died and one was culled as a result of the outbreak that began on May 22.
content_2: In the Uttar Dinajpur district of West Bengal twenty rural backyard poultry died in an outbreak that began on May 20. All domestic poultry in a 3km radius have been culled and the owners have been compensated. Within a 10km radius all poultry markets have been closed and premises have been disinfected.
content_3: A four-year-old boy and a four-year-old girl from the Sharqeya governate in the Nile Delta were confirmed of contracting H5N1 bird flu on May 27. The girl fell ill on May 23 and the boy fell ill the next day both have been hospitalized and are in stable condition after being treated with Tamiflu. There have now been 76 human cases of bird flu in Egypt since the disease first appeared.
